conversations.value: Oh my gosh, Mon, look at this photo! Can you believe how long that train is?

Wow, that is one serious piece of engineering. I bet it took incredible planning and organization to coordinate its journey. You know, kind of like organizing a wedding, but with more steel and less... flowers.
Haha, definitely less flowers! And can you imagine me trying to run away from a wedding on that thing? I doubt I'd get very far before someone caught me.
I'd give you about four cars in before tripping over something because you’d be in one of your fancy dresses!
Absolutely, and I’d probably be in heels, so there's no chance I'd make a graceful escape. But hey, look at the colors on the locomotives. It's kind of stylish, don't you think?
You would think about style when looking at a train. But I get it; they do have a certain... flair. Maybe you could’ve started a new trend: bridal train escape by train.
Not a bad idea for a themed runaway bride story. Too bad my running away days are behind me.
Hopefully, Ross doesn't get any ideas about train weddings now; you know how he gets about 'transportation and history.'
Oh no, I can totally picture him geeking out about it. "Did you know, Rachel, that trains symbolized progress in the industrial era?"
And I'd be like, "Please, can we just focus on the catering and not the locomotion history?"
Haha, exactly! But honestly, it's kind of peaceful, isn't it? All those open spaces and the train just rolling through...
Yeah, it does have a serene vibe. Makes you want to pack a picnic and watch the trains go by. But I’d have to make sure the blanket is perfectly squared on the ground, obviously.
Mon, never change. You and your perfect picnics. But I bet it would be the best train-watching picnic ever.
Whoa, check this out, Mon! That food looks delicious, doesn't it? I mean, the eggs, the bacon... Oh, man! I can practically smell it through the picture!
Joey, it's a photo; you can't smell it. But yes, it does look good. They scrambled those eggs just right, and look at that glistening bacon. I would've added a sprig of parsley though, for color.

Parsley, shmarsley! You can't eat parsley. Well, you can, but why? Now bacon, that's the stuff. Is that tomato grilled? You know what's missing though? A big stack of pancakes. With syrup. Lots of syrup.
Oh Joey, it's not about quantity, but the quality and balance of the meal. And yes, grilled tomatoes are a nice touch. Healthy too. You should try adding some veggies to your breakfast, you know.
Veggies for breakfast? Come on, Mon, you know me better than that. Although that orange juice does look pretty good. I wouldn't mind a glass... as long as it doesn't take up room for coffee.
Joey, Joey, Joey, you need your vitamins. Especially with your... let's say 'active' lifestyle. And I'd say that orange juice looks freshly squeezed. You'd appreciate the effort behind that.
Effort, huh? Alright, I'll give you that. And as long as it pairs well with the sausages and eggs, I'm in. But you gotta admit, this is a breakfast for champions!

Fine, it's a hearty breakfast. I'd probably serve it with some whole grain toast – get some fiber in there. Oh, and is that a coffee pot I see? I'd love a cup right now. It looks like it could actually be strong enough for my taste.
You and your strong coffee, Mon. It'd probably put hair on my chest! But hey, if there's coffee, I'm there. Just keep it away from my plate. Joey doesn't share food... or his coffee spot!
I know, I know. But you could learn a thing or two about sharing, Mr. Tribbiani. Sharing is caring!
Yeah, yeah, I care... about having this whole breakfast to myself. Now, if this was a real breakfast and not just a picture, I'd be the happiest guy in the world!
Of course, you would. Next time I host brunch, I'll make sure to recreate this for you. Though I reserve the right to add a garnish. Deal?
Deal! Only if you promise it'll look as good as this picture. I can barely wait, Mon. It's like torture looking at this and not being able to eat it!
Whoa, check this out Mon, doesn't this train station look kinda... I don't know, lonely to you?
Yeah, it does have a certain eerie vibe to it. Kinda like the one in that movie where the guy's waiting for a ghost train or something. Remember?
Oh yeah, totally! It makes you wonder where all the people are. You think they've got a good pizza place near that station?
Joey, not everything is about pizza. But I admit, standing there alone, waiting... that's like the perfect time to eat a slice. I wouldn't mind having a snack there myself.
See! You get it. Food makes everything better. Plus, look at those lights. Kinda like they're leading to some sorta magical pizza place. I bet it's 'Monica clean' there too.
So you finally appreciate my level of clean? But you're right about those lights; they're so symmetrical. It's kind of satisfying just to look at them.
Totally, although, if I was there, I'd be more interested in the destination. Like, where's this train going? Hopefully somewhere with less 'eerie vibe.'
Maybe it's going to an alternate universe where your acting career's as big as your appetite!
Hey, my career's gonna take off, you'll see. And when it does, our alternate universe selves will be having this same conversation, only we'll be on, like, a private jet, not a train platform.
I can picture it now. Chef Monica with her own cooking show. That would be the dream, right?
And I'll be your first guest! I can be the taste tester. You know, "Joey doesn't share food," but I’ll definitely eat it!
I would expect nothing less from you, Joey. But come on, we should probably head back. It’s getting late, and I have some actual cleaning to do.
What's not to like? Train platforms? Good. Pizza places? Good. Magical alternate universes? Good! But fine, let's head out. You know I can't resist hanging out in your sparkling clean apartment!
Could this bus BE any more alone in the parking lot? I mean, where are all the people? Did they go on an adventure and forget to invite the bus?
It does look kind of deserted, huh? Maybe it's taking a break from all the passengers. You know, like when I need the kitchen to myself after a long day.
Yeah, because buses and exhausted chefs are basically the same thing.
Well, they both carry a lot of baggage! Although, I'm not saying that you're baggage, dear.
I'm not baggage. I'm more like the emergency exit - there in case of a sudden need to escape but generally avoided for safer options.
Escape from what? Not from my seven-layer cookies, I hope.
No way, I'd never abandon those. Unless the bus here is going on a direct route to Joey’s new sandwich shop.
Ha, not unless he figured out how to drive something bigger than a sandwich to his mouth. Besides, weren’t we talking about getting you on a health kick?
A health kick. It’s like dodgeball all over again - just when you’re finally enjoying the game, someone kicks you with the health ball.
But admit it, you secretly love dodgeball.
Only when I can duck and nobody notices.
Well, maybe we can catch that bus and take a nice, long walk wherever it ends up. Good for health, right?
Sounds like a perfect plan. As long as the destination is anywhere but the land of no cookies.
Oh my gosh, Mon, look at this picture – the clock tower is just stunning. It's giving me serious London vibes, doesn't it remind you of when we all went to Ross’s wedding?
Absolutely! But you know this is actually making me think of that episode where Chandler couldn't find the cameras. Could you imagine if we were there and he lost all our photos again?
Ha! I know, right? I mean, we’d have to find some local version of Gunther to make our coffee and laugh at all our jokes about Chandler.
Plus, it looks so clean and orderly, I’d probably spend the whole time just admiring the architecture... you know, without all the pigeons.
True, but those pigeons are part of the charm, Mon! And by charm, I mean an endless possibility for bird poop disasters. Remember, I almost got that mark on the dress?

How could I forget? I was mere seconds away from having a full-blown meltdown. By the way, remember the tower we saw just like this one? Made me want to set up a whole dining area up there... could you imagine that view?
With you cooking? Monica, you’d turn that clock tower into the hottest spot in the city! I'd definitely be a regular, along with, oh, every important person in fashion.
You think? You know, as long as no one minds climbing what? A hundred stairs? I bet I could start a trend — ‘Staircase Suppers’ or ‘Meals with a View’!
I’d climb two hundred stairs for your lasagna. There, I said it!
Alright, it's settled then. My next job, 'Chef Monica: Above the Clouds'. But really, Rach, we should plan a trip and actually go see this place one day.
Only if we're not on a break from Ross, I can't handle one more dramatic airport scene in my life!
Oh my gosh, Mon, look at this building! Isn't it just gorgeous with all the glass? It’s like the ultimate chic fashion statement but for architecture!
Wow, you're right, Rach! It’s stunning. Can you imagine trying to keep those windows clean though? It would be a full-time job – not just clean, Monica clean.
Ha, only you would think about the cleaning part. But seriously, it feels very fashion-forward, don't you think? It'd be the perfect backdrop for a photo shoot.
Definitely. And hey, look at that guy skateboarding. He’s pretty good. Do you remember when Joey tried skateboarding that one time?
How could I forget? He nearly broke his... Well, let's just say thank goodness for health insurance, right?
Absolutely. Speaking of which, remember my brother’s total lack of coordination? Ross on a skateboard, that would be a sight. I'd pay money to see that.
Yeah, and then you’d have to cook Thanksgiving dinner all by yourself because you know he’d end up in the hospital.
True, that's part of why I married Chandler; He knows better than to get on one of those things.
True! Oh, and look at that person sitting over there with a laptop. They look super focused. It reminds me of you when you’re planning your next big dinner party.

You mean my organized fun? Yeah, I guess. But seriously, Rach, imagine us sitting there, sipping on some coffee, looking out at the water. That would be so relaxing. Plus, no one can make coffee drop or crumb on the floor from that distance.
Now that sounds perfect. And by the way, we have to bring Phoebe – she'd probably start playing her guitar and singing about the 'shiny glass building of dreams' or something.
That’s Phoebe for you – turning everything into a song. Anyway, it's decided. Next girls' day is by the cool shiny building, with coffee, music, and no skateboards for Ross.
It's a date! But can we go shopping first? There's got to be some cute boutiques around a place like that!
Shopping then coffee – it's like the best day ever planned. But Rach, we are not going to any pet stores; I can't handle you impulsively adopting another 'Mrs. Whiskerson.'
Fine, fine, no pet stores. But a girl can never have too many shoes... or cats.
Oh wow, look at this, Mon. This guy's totally in sync with the waves. It's like he's dancing with the ocean.
Yeah, he's got some serious skills. It's all about balance and control, you know. Kind of like cooking a perfect soufflé.
Huh, I never thought about surfing as the 'soufflé of the sea'. You think I could surf? I mean, I have the whole 'commune with nature' vibe going on.
No doubt you’d be one with the waves, Pheebs. But remember that time we went to the beach and you said the sand was attacking you?
Oh right. The sand spirits were very aggressive that day. Maybe I could surf in a pool? No sand there.
You’d probably start a new trend, Phoebe – pool surfing! It's so out there, it might just work, especially with your unagi... Oh wait, that's Ross's thing.
Yeah, and it's not even a thing. It's just eel. But look at this guy, he’s all twisty. If he were a pastry, what kind would he be?
Twisty? Definitely a pretzel, one of those big soft ones that go great with mustard.
Ooh, I want a pretzel now. Do you think it's a sign? Like, the universe wants me to have a pretzel.
It’s probably just your stomach wanting a pretzel. But hey, let's grab some after we finish here. And maybe get you a surfboard-shaped pretzel, huh?
Monica, you truly are the Michelangelo of party snacks.
Oh my God, Mon, look at this! Do you see what I’m seeing?
If you’re seeing a table that's begging for a cleanup, then yes! And are those doughnuts I spot?
Exactly! Doughnuts, free for the taking! It’s like they’re just calling out, “Pick me, pick me!” It’s like that time at Bloomingdale's when they left out a tray of perfume samples.
Don't get me wrong, I'm all for free doughnuts, but why are they just... there? It's actually making me more suspicious than excited, Rach.
Oh come on, Mon, don’t be such a buzzkill! You’re thinking too much, like that time you made a spreadsheet for cookie ingredients. It’s a free pass to Doughnut Heaven!

A buzzkill? Me? I’m just being Monica, okay? And besides, I'm betting you twenty bucks that table is outside a meeting room. Probably an AA meeting–you shouldn't take doughnuts from an AA meeting, Rachel.
Wait, why would someone bring doughnuts to an AA meeting? That seems... counterproductive. And I am not touching that bet, I learned my lesson after that poker night.
Maybe it’s a sign, like the universe telling us everything comes with a price, even if it's dressed up as a doughnut left on a slightly messy table next to a trash can.
You know what, Mon? Sometimes a doughnut is just a doughnut. And that one there, the chocolate-glazed one with sprinkles? That’s the universe telling me it needs to be appreciated.

Haha! Oh, you and your romantic doughnut ideas. Just make sure the universe’s message doesn’t include extra inches on your waistline! But fine, if you're going, grab me one too – but only if there’s a raspberry-filled one!
As your roommate and accomplice in life's unexpected joys, it'll be my mission to make sure we both enjoy this  bounty. But afterwards, we are hitting the gym, lady!
You’re on! But I’m picking the workout, Rachel. If we’re doing this, we’re doing it Monica style – not just gym, Monica gym! Now, go be the doughnut hero we didn't know we needed.
And you can be my trusty sidekick, Monica, the Enforcer of Order. Together, there’s no pastry we can’t conquer. Let's do this!
Hey Mon, check this out! What do you think this machine does?
Joey, that’s a classic! That’s a dough sheeter. You use it to roll out dough evenly for baking. Perfect for when I make my homemade pasta or pastries!
Dough sheeter, huh? So it's like a pizza's first step to greatness!
Exactly! You can make all kinds of dough with this. It's about precision and perfection, which I love. Imagine rolling out dough for hundreds of cookies without this—total nightmare!
Oh man, speaking of cookies, remember when you made those chocolate chip ones? I still dream about them. Any chance those will be making a comeback?
Joey, you know I can’t resist baking, especially for my friends. But you have to promise me you’ll try not to eat them all in one sitting this time.
Monica, when it comes to food, I make no promises. But hey, for your cookies? I’ll try. Maybe you could use this machine to make a GIANT cookie!
No. Joey, this machine is for precision, not for making giant food items. And besides, if I made a giant cookie, how would you even bake it?
I dunno, maybe build a giant oven? With a giant glass of milk to go with it!
Joey. Well, until we get a giant oven, I'll stick to normal-sized cookies, thank you very much. Now help me figure out where to put this in my kitchen.
Alright, but if we're moving that thing, I'm gonna need some of those cookies you mentioned as fuel!
Deal, but I'm timing you. Your cookie fuel efficiency better be high!
You got it, Mon! But... how long does it take for cookie dough to become cookies again? Because I'm already hungry...
Joey. You and food. Alright, let's move this and then we'll talk about baking some cookies together. Deal?
Deal! But I'm serious about the giant cookie. Think about it, would be legendary!
Okay, okay. Maybe for your birthday, huh? Now come on, we've got work to do!
Look at these ducks, Mon. Could they BE any more synchronized?
Those are actually Egyptian geese, Chandler. And yes, they're pretty coordinated. I bet they clean their nests compulsively.
So basically they're you, but with feathers and a beak. Nice!
Ha-ha. Very funny. Didn't you once think a pigeon was a duck?
In my defense, it was a very duck-like pigeon. It quacked. Well, at least in my head.
Keep telling yourself that. Anyway, I think these geese look majestic, don't you think? Like they own that pond.
Absolutely. If I could be any animal, I'd be a majestic goose. Walking around, owning ponds, not giving a quack. What about you? I'm guessing a racehorse, considering your love of running things.
A racehorse? Really, Chandler? What about something like a... squirrel? Agile, always gathering stuff, organizing nuts...
And so much energy. That's definitely you, especially when you're on one of your cleaning frenzies.
Speaking of cleaning, we should take a note out of these geese's book and go clean out the pond in Central Park.
You just want to go there so you can boss around the ducks... or geese. Teaching them the 'Monica Clean' way.
Maybe I do. They could use some structure. But for now, let's just enjoy this little slice of nature, shall we?
Agreed. But if we're going nature-watching, I'm going to need snacks. Something tells me duck-watching... I mean, goose-watching, works up an appetite.
Knowing you, you'd eat the snacks before we even get there. Come on, I'll make us some duck... I mean goose-friendly sandwiches. No feeding, just watching!
As long as it's not Thanksgiving turkey-flavored, I'm on board. There's only so much poultry one man can handle.
Look at this, Mon! That skier is just like, slicing through the snow like it's butter! Wouldn't it be so whimsical to be that free?
It does look amazing, Pheebs, but can you imagine the amount of planning and training it takes to get that good? I mean, those turns are perfect.
Yeah, but all those little lines in the snow, they're so... regimented. Snow should be wild, like my hair in the morning! Ha!
God, remember when we all tried to go skiing and I spent like hours making those packed lunch boxes? I labelled every sandwich, too.
Yes! And then, Joey didn't even eat his because he traded it for some magic beans... Oh, Joey! And I ended up feeding mine to a squirrel. I think it was a squirrel.
That was such a typical Joey move. And your "squirrel" was definitely a snowboarder, Phoebe. Anyway, I was so busy making sure we had everything organized I forgot to enjoy the actual skiing!
Well, you're always the hostess, Mon. Next time we should just wing it, you know, let the snowy spirits guide us!
Maybe, just maybe, I could let go a little and stop trying to control everything. But I am definitely packing emergency snacks. No squirrel - or snowboarder - goes hungry on my watch!
Deal! Oh! We should sing to the snowy mountain spirits! I'll bring my guitar, and we can perform 'Smelly Cat' as an ode to the wilderness!
Oh boy. I'm pretty sure the snowy mountain spirits would prefer it if you left the guitar at home. We don't want an avalanche on our hands!
Ha! That's just like your hair, Mon. Always trying to be so straight and tidy, but I know the wild waves are just waiting to burst out!
Okay, okay. Maybe I'd let my hair down just a bit. But only if you promise not to read my aura on the ski lift. Deal?

Deal! Oh, I can't wait! We'll have the best time, and I'll keep all the mystical snow vibes in check. It'll be like a winter wonderland adventure. Maybe we can even find my snowboarder-squirrel friend again!
I just hope your snowboarder-squirrel friend doesn't eat my sandwiches again. But I'm in, Phoebe. Let's make it a trip to remember - Organized fun, with a side of Phoebe's spontaneity.

Wow, look at this, Mon. That's a huge aircraft, isn't it? It looks like a C-17 Globemaster or something, used for massive airlifts. Imagine if dinosaurs were still around and we needed to transport them, this would be like real-life Jurassic Park stuff!

Oh my God, Ross, you and your dinosaurs. But yeah, that plane is massive. Hopefully, they're transporting something more interesting than just military equipment. Like, what if they're moving the world's largest collection of non-stick pans? Now that would be exciting!

Somehow I think the Air Force has more pressing cargo than your kitchenware obsession, sis. But you've got to admit, the logistics of moving something so big is fascinating. Do you think they use a checklist? Or maybe they have a 'planes, trains, and automobiles' day planner?
I bet they have a checklist, and it's probably color-coded and laminated. Something I should consider for organizing my next Thanksgiving dinner.
Yeah, they definitely don't want to end up with a 'my sandwich' situation at 30,000 feet. I mean, MY SANDWICH!
Calm down, Ross. No one's going to eat the plane's sandwich. But hey, I bet you'd love to be part of their team, huh? Telling everyone to "Pivot! Pivot!" as they load giant fossils onboard.
That'd be a dream job for me! Plus, I could give them a lecture on the history of paleontology during the flight. Educational and efficient!
Sure, because there's nothing like a captive audience that can't escape because they're flying in the stratosphere. Ross, sometimes I can't tell if you're serious or not.
I'm serious. It's like my own version of "Unagi," being always alert and ready to spread knowledge. You'll see, one day you'll all appreciate my "on a plane" paleontology seminar.

Well, I’ll start appreciating it as soon as they start serving your theoretical dinosaur meat in a new five-star recipe. Could you imagine? Delicacies from the Mesozoic Era? That might actually get me on that plane!
Monica and culinary time travel – now that's a concept. I'm sure you’d make an amazing Pterodactyl Parmesan. But seriously, next time they do an air show, I'm dragging you along. It'll be a blast.
Only if you promise not to go into full Ross-mode and start ranting about fossil contamination and such. Deal?
Deal. But we were on a break from fossil contamination rants.
Hey Mon, check out this guy playin' tennis. You know, I tried hittin' a few balls once. It did not go well.
Well, Joey, tennis requires a little more precision than, say, throwing sandwiches into your mouth.
Har-har, very funny. But do you think, with my athleticism, if I practiced, I could be like one of those famous tennis players?

Well, you're definitely athletic, but... It's not about hitting the ball hard, Joey. It's about hitting it where the other person isn't. Remember your foosball strategy? Think like that, but with a racquet and a ball.
That makes sense. But I gotta tell ya, all this talk about hitting balls is making me think about meatballs, which makes me hungry. They ever serve those at tennis matches?
No, Joey, it's more of a strawberries and cream kind of sport. Very posh.
Strawberries and cream, huh? Not bad, but it could use a sandwich on the side. So, guess what, I bet that guy's thinking about his lunch too, huh?
Joey. I think he's more likely thinking about his serve or the next point. But, you might be onto something with tennis-themed sandwiches. "The Joey Special: Tennis Edition"?
Yeah! Like, a "Grand Slam-wich"! You could help me make it—Monica clean, Monica tasty!
I love it. But if we're making it, we're making it right—perfectly balanced with lean protein for energy, fresh greens, on whole-grain bread. Game, set, match, Joey.
Oh man, you had me until you said whole-grain. But I trust ya, Mon. If anyone can make whole-grain delicious, it's you. Just maybe sneak in a little extra meat for me, okay?
We'll see, Joey. Maybe if you actually manage to return a tennis serve, I'll consider it. That can be our little wager.
You got it! And hey, if I win, maybe I'll take up tennis and become the next... uh, what's a famous tennis player's name?
How about Serena Williams? Except in your case, it would be Joey Tribbiani, king of the 'Grand Slam-wich'!
I like it. It's settled then. Joey Tribbiani, the sandwich-serving, tennis-playing, uh, king of the court!

Wow, look at that, Mon. That's an Asian elephant if I'm not mistaken. Notice the smaller ears compared to the African variety. And those decorations! It's like seeing a page from a history book in living color.
It is beautiful, Ross. Although I hope that elephant is being treated well. You know how I feel about animal welfare. Plus, do you see how clean that area is? Somebody is doing an amazing job.
Yeah, I'm sure they are, but back to the elephant – these creatures are incredible. You know, they have such a complex social structure and... did you know they mourn their dead?

I remember you mentioning that before. That's so intensely sweet and sad. It just makes me want to organize a fundraiser for elephant conservation. We could have it at my place! Themed snacks, trivia, maybe even a silent auction?
That's actually a great idea, Mon. And I could probably do a talk about paleontology and how it helps us understand modern animals!
I'll be in charge of planning, of course. I'll make lists, schedules, and I'll get everything 'Monica clean' for the big day. I want every little detail to be perfect.
Classic Monica. But don't stress too much, okay? It's for a good cause, and everyone will just be happy to help out.
Stressing over parties and gatherings is my middle name, Ross. Speaking of details, did you notice the attire on the elephant? Phenomenal color coordination. It gives me ideas for the decorations!
Leave it to you to turn an elephant into an event inspiration. But hey, as long as it does the trick for raising awareness, I'm all in. So, what do you say? Are we teaming up for this?
Absolutely! "Team Geller" always wins. And this time, we'll be winning for the elephants.
Could that BE any taller without entering the stratosphere?
Stop, Chandler, giraffes are supposed to be tall. It's like... their thing, aside from eating leaves at the very top of the trees.
You know, if Joey saw these guys, he'd definitely ask if they played basketball.
Babe, do you think the one in the back feels left out 'cause we can't see his face? You know I can't stand it when someone feels left out of the group photo.
Absolutely. He's probably back there thinking, "Oh my God, could I BE any more out of frame?"
I think that giraffe in the back is just fine. But you, mister, have to work on your photography skills - we're going to need clear shots for the twins' scrapbook.
Well, I guess that means we just have to come back for another photo session. It's all in the name of art... and appeasing the scrapbook overlord.
Don't joke about that! Those scrapbooks will be family treasures one day. I want to make sure Erica and Jack have every awkward animal photo they can handle.
I can imagine it now, 'Here’s the giraffe family who was way cooler than your dad.' Can we AT LEAST go see something that doesn't make me question my vertical challenges? How about the penguins?
Sure, honey. But only if you promise to take a photo with them. You know, to keep it consistent with the 'awkward animal photo' theme.
Great, so instead of being overshadowed by giraffe necks, I'll be waddling in solidarity with flightless birds. This is turning out to be quite the self-esteem-boosting trip.
Don't worry, you'll always be my alpha penguin. Let's go find us some fish-eating tuxedo wearers.
Whoa, Monica, check this out! That's one fancy lookin' drink. What do you think that green thing stickin' out is? It's huge!
Joey, that's a pickle. It’s actually pretty common to put a pickle in a Bloody Mary. Adds a little extra flavor.
A pickle? In a drink? I mean, cucumbers are okay in those fancy waters, but a pickle? That’s a whole new level! Hey, isn't that like... salad in a glass?
It's garnish, Joey. And honestly, a good Bloody Mary is about balance – spice from the Tabasco, tang from the tomato juice, and that little bit of saltiness from the pickle totally works.
Okay, I get the spicy and salty part. Hey, doesn't it need more meat, though? You know, to make it a real meal? Oh! How about a meatball on a stick in there, huh?
I'm not sure the world is ready for Joey's Meatball Bloody Mary. But actually, some places do put a strip of bacon in it. It’s like breakfast in a cup!
Bacon, huh? I could get on board with that. Imagine havin' this for breakfast every day. It's got tomato, so that's like, what, one or two of the important food groups?
Somehow I don't think drinking a cocktail for breakfast is a balanced diet, even with a vegetable in it. And you're forgetting, it's got alcohol, Joey.
Geez, alcohol too? It’s like this drink’s got a surprise at every level. Hey Mon, you ever think about making one of these with your chef skills? Monica Clean-style?

Joey, if I made you a Bloody Mary, it would be the best Bloody Mary you’ve ever tasted. Perfectly clean and organized, with just the right amount of everything. I’ll even put a mini sandwich on a skewer for you - Joey doesn't share food, but I'm sure Joey would share a drink with himself!
Mon, you had me at mini sandwich. Let’s do this! "How you doin', Best Bloody Mary I've ever tasted?" Haha!
Oh my god, I can't with you. Alright, next Sunday brunch, I’m making them. But I’m not cleaning up after you get the 'meat sweats', deal?
Deal! But 'meat sweats' are totally worth it when food - I mean, drink - is involved. You’re the best, Mon!
Look at this, Mon! Do you think this is a beginners' surf spot? The waves aren't exactly 'Hang Ten' caliber, are they?
For sure. Those waves are more 'Hang Five and a Half' at best. But hey, look at her form, she seems focused. It's the kind of determination I bring to the kitchen.
And the competitive spirit you bring to, uh, everything else.

Very funny, Ross! But you know, there's something to be said for starting small. You know, I didn't just start out making a perfect Thanksgiving dinner. It took years of...scrutinizing your eating expressions for approval.

True, your early cooking was the culinary equivalent of... this. But see how she's balancing, reading the wave? She’s in her own element, kind of like you with a spatula in hand or me with a...dinosaur bone?
Speaking of bones, look at that, she's wearing a wetsuit! Ross, remember that time you thought "wetsuit" was some sort of a tuxedo that you could swim in?
I was very young - and fashion-forward, might I add. Anyway, kudos to her for embracing the learning curve. Reminds me of my attempts at playing the bagpipes.
Haha, yeah, 'attempts' is the right word. And those sounds... still haunt me. But I do admire her effort. It's like when I tried to make macarons for the first time. Remember the 'maca-wrongs’?
How could I forget? They were harder than the trivia questions I make up. But at least she won't have to deal with Joey and Chandler as her taste-testers.
That's true. But if she sticks with it, she’ll be riding the big waves in no time. And maybe you could do the same with the bagpipes, minus the migraines you gave all of us.
Ha, yes. Well, I admire her persistence. It's an essential trait, in the ocean or life in general. She's probably thinking, "We were 'on the breakwater!'"
Oh no, you did not just make that pun! That's worse than the time you bleached your teeth.
Hey, that was a radiant moment for me. Much like this will be when she catches her first big wave.
Ross. You and your metaphors. Let's just hope her first big moment is less... fluorescent.
Whoa, check this out, Mon. That's gotta be like the best view from any window seat, huh?
Oh my God, yes, it's beautiful! Look at those mountains. But can you imagine the turbulence? Ugh, I'd be a nervous wreck.
Haha, yeah, you would. But hey, imagine if you were up there, you could be like, "How YOU doin', Mount Everest?" even though, you know, it's probably not Everest.
Joey, you cannot flirt with a mountain. And that's definitely the Alps, by the way, not the Himalayas.
Right, right, the Alps, of course. I knew that... So, got any plans to do something as wild as that, Mon? Flying over mountains?
I think I'll leave the wild adventures to you and Chandler. I'd be too busy making sure my in-flight meal was up to standard. Plus, you think they'd let me cook at 30,000 feet?
If you were on that plane, I'd bet even the pilot would want a taste of your cooking. And speaking of meals, you think they serve sandwiches on there that I wouldn't have to share?
"Joey doesn't share food!" Not even in the sky, huh? And you would totally charm the flight attendants into giving you extra, anyway.
You know it! But hey, flying over those snowy mountains... think they have snowball fights up there? I could totally see you getting competitive about that.
Alright, but only if we make it a clean game. Snowballs must be perfectly round, no rocks or ice, and we keep score. I'm not losing to you in snowball accuracy!
Okay, okay, 'Monica clean' snowball fights. It's on! But if we're doing this, you gotta promise me no counting to seven like last time. That was too much pressure!
Hey, you have to admit, that was a very thorough teaching method. And besides, it's my job to bring the competitive edge. Wouldn't want you to get soft on me, Tribbiani.
Never, Mon. But if we're up against those mountains, we gotta do it before the meat sweats start, you know, from all that food they'll be throwing at us once they get a bite of your cooking.

Meat sweats at high altitude might just be your most unique challenge yet. But sure, Joey, we'll eat, we'll cook, we'll have our snowball fight, and then you can charm everyone on the plane with your one-liners.
It's a deal, Geller. And you can organize the whole trip - you're always the hostess! But I'm telling ya, if there's a mountain ranger up there, I'm definitely gonna ask, "How you doin'?"
There you go, staying in character even in imaginary scenarios. Just promise me we'll actually stay on the plane and not end up lost in the Alps, okay?
That's easy, I won't get off the plane as long as they keep feeding me. But if we see a Yeti, I'm getting his autograph. That's like a celebrity sighting, right?
Joey, never change. But if there's a Yeti, I'm putting you in charge of getting photos. I'll be too busy keeping us on schedule—can't miss the in-flight snacks!
Look at that! A peach, a banana, and a cucumber just chilling on top of... is that a pile of trash? Kinda makes me hungry though. What’s with the fruit, Mon?
Seriously, Joey? Hungry? It’s literally on top of garbage, and you think of food? Anyway, it seems like someone was trying to salvage the good stuff from being thrown out. Waste not, want not, right?

Yeah, I guess you're right. But still, you can’t deny that peach looks pretty good! Oh, and speaking of good food, remember that pie you made last week? I mean, with those fruits there, you could totally whip up a Joey special fruit salad.

No, Joey! You can’t just take food from the trash. Plus, my fruit salad would need, you know, not trashed fruit. And I’m not making any pie until you stop eating my desserts without asking. Remember, Joey doesn’t share food? Well, Monica doesn’t like food stealers!

Okay, okay, you got me there. But can you blame a guy for loving your cooking? By the way, you ever think about how sad it is that all this perfectly good food gets thrown out? I mean, I’d give that peach a home.

Only you, Joey, only you would think about adopting a peach... But yes, it’s a huge problem. Did you know that so much of what’s tossed could be donated? Food shelters would love to have this kind of stuff. Maybe, I could volunteer more at the local kitchen. They’re always in need of help.

You know what, Mon, that’s actually a great idea! And hey, if they need an extra pair of hands, or you know, someone to make sure the food tastes right, I'm there! But uh, maybe we skip on the trash-picking, huh?

Absolutely, Joey. No trash-picking. I’ll just stick to cooking with ingredients that don’t come with their own garbage can. But yeah, it would be nice to do something about all the waste. Anyway, let's change the subject; I can't look at this anymore without thinking of all the cleaning I'd have to do.

All right, all right, no more trash talk. So... you think they intentionally put the green, yellow, and red together like that? Kinda looks like a traffic light. Maybe it’s a sign for hungry people to stop?
Oh my God, Joey, you’re impossible. But it does look like a traffic light. I guess in your world it's saying, "Go ahead, Joey. Eat the peach!”
You know me too well, Mon. But don't worry, I'll hold myself back. This time.
Oh my God, look at this, Mon! It's like nature's own TV show, way better than "Mac and C.H.E.E.S.E."!
Wow, that's an amazing shot, Joey. That zebra's stripes are so... clean and perfect. Kind of reminds me of my towels after I fold them.
Clean towels, zebra stripes... Ah, I don't see it. But hey, you think that guy ever gets confused, like, "Am I white with black stripes or black with white stripes?"

Joey, I'm sure it doesn't think about it as much as you do. Besides, it's more about camouflage in their habitat. Think about it, when it's running, the stripes make it hard for predators to focus on just one.
Like me with a plate of sandwiches, huh? It's all a blur of deliciousness.
Exactly, Joey! And you wouldn't want to share those sandwiches with anyone, would you?
"Joey doesn't share food!" But I'd share with you, Mon! If... you were, like, really hungry... and there was like, an apocalypse or something.
I appreciate that, but let's just stick to watching zebras. So much less complicated than dating and relationships, don't you think?
Totally! I mean, who needs the drama when you've got these black-and-white beauties? Uh, unless the zebra is a girl zebra... "How you doin'?" No, no, I'm kidding!
Oh, Joey, never change. Speaking of black and white, those stripes would make an amazing pattern for a tablecloth. I could do a whole safari-themed dinner!
Now you're talking my language! Food and themes, I'm in. But you know what would be really cool—having one of these guys as a pet!
Joey, that would be illegal and completely impractical. Plus, where would you put one in your apartment?
Hmm, good point. Maybe I'll just stick to watching "Baywatch" re-runs. Nothing beats running in slow motion, not even zebras.
And we can always go to the zoo! Or better yet, how about a Friends trip to a safari park?
A safari park! That's such a Monica plan. Let's do it! Maybe they'll have meat-flavored ice cream too. Now that'd be like the best day ever!
We'll see about the ice cream, but a trip sounds great. It's a date, but not a date date, just a friend date.
The best kind of dates if you ask me!

Hey Mon, look at this photo. This whole setup looks kind of familiar, doesn't it? I mean, the stuffed animal at the breakfast table? It's just like that time you insisted on bringing Mr. Wiggles to the diner.
Oh my God, Ross! How could I forget? I was eight, and if I remember correctly, you brought your rock collection to the table more than once. Very sophisticated, Dr. Geller.

Guilty as charged. But hey, at least my rocks didn't need a separate chair. Anyway, look at how happy that little girl is with her stuffed friend. It must be a special day for her, like a birthday or something.

Yeah, maybe. And look at that meal—colorful, healthy. You've got fruit, milk, toast... I approve! It’s definitely something I’d serve for breakfast, minus the bread on the edge of the plate. That's just bad table setting.

That's because you need everything 'Monica clean' and in the 'Monica right place'. Anyway, it takes me back to our childhood meals—full of laughter, occasional food fights, and Mom freaking out over the mess.
Those were some great times, weren't they? Even if you did always manage to spill something. And look at that, her glass of milk is full. That would never have lasted with you—"Spilly Geller."

Ha ha, Monica. You know, from a cultural standpoint, it's fascinating to see how universal the concept of a plush toy as a comfort object is. Across countries, across cultures... Dinosaurs never had that. Maybe if they did, they wouldn't have gone extinct.

Right, because what the T-Rex needed was a plushie to survive the asteroid. Seriously though, I do get what you're saying. It’s sweet, and it reminds me that some things are just so simple and universally joyous.
Exactly, even as a paleontologist, I can't argue with the warmth of a childhood memory. And oh—look at the size of those fruit chunks! Someone is cutting fruit like you do, dangerously large.
Hey, you only complain until you eat them! I mean who wouldn't want a mouthful of delicious fruit? Though she seems a bit smarter, using a fork there.
Very true, and by the way, you still owe me a rematch on that Thanksgiving football game.
Bring it, Ross. But just so you know, I've been training. You're going down!
It's on. But back to that little girl. That glow, that pure joy... I hope she knows how precious these moments are. They really do stick with you.
Yeah, they do. And let's be honest, for her, it’s about being with her favorite toy. For you, it was about getting to the breakfast bar without dropping anything.
Always got to have the last word, huh?
You know it, big brother. Always.
Oh my God, Mon, look at these zebras! Don't they just have the most amazing patterns? It's like, nature's own version of couture.

Right? It's incredible, Rach. It’s like each one is wearing a unique outfit. Perfectly tailored, no alterations needed! And look at this one, it's like it’s posing for us. A natural in front of the camera!
Totally! If only they knew just how stylish they are... Can you imagine one walking down the runway? I bet it would fit right in at Fashion Week.
Ha! That I’d love to see. But knowing you, you’d probably find a way to make 'zebra chic' the next big thing in the fashion world.
You think so? Maybe that's not such a bad idea... “Inspired by the wild.” Oh, but the fabric choices would be a nightmare.
Hey, if anyone can make it work, it's you. But honestly, every time I see animals like these, I'm just amazed. The environment they live in, the way they adapt – it's all so impressive, isn't it?
It really is. Makes you want to respect nature more, y'know. Even if my idea of 'adapting' is figuring out what to wear when the weather changes.
Speaking of adapting, check out the trees and the dry grass. Looks like it hasn’t rained here in a while. These animals are survivors. Nature’s version of tough cookies, huh?
Yeah, talk about being resourceful. Kinda reminds me of us when we had to fix Thanksgiving dinner that one time when everything went wrong.
Don't remind me. But we nailed it, didn't we? If we were in the wild, I bet we'd be just like these zebras, all clever and...
Stylish?
Exactly! And resilient! After all, I'm "Monica clean" and you? You’re definitely "Rachel chic".
Love that, Mon! So, want to plan a safari-themed party? I’m thinking zebra-striped appetizers?
You read my mind. But no actual zebras, please. Just zebra-striped napkins and maybe some cute animal print cupcakes.
It's a deal. But can we also have those little cocktail umbrellas? They could be our little 'shade trees'.
We'll make it the best safari party ever... without leaving Manhattan.
Now that's what I call "wild" living.
Hey Mon, check this out! What do you think they're all cheering for?
Oh wow, Joey, that looks like some kind of parade or celebration. Look at all those people!
Yeah! And there's all this confetti around, kinda makes me want to join in. You think they're throwing a pizza party?
Oh please, not everything's about food, Joey. But with this crowd, it's probably something big!
Big? Like Godzilla big? 'Cause that I gotta see.
No, Joey, not Godzilla big. I mean a big occasion. And would you stop thinking about your next audition for a minute?
You're right, Mon. But hey, there's something about all these happy faces that kinda reminds me of us, y'know, when we're all together.
That's actually really sweet, Joey. And you just gave me a great idea for a theme party - "Celebration of Us"!
Heh, I like that! But uh, we can have food there too, right? 'Cause nothing says 'celebration' like a good sandwich... or two... or twelve.
Of course, Joey. Food is key. But "Monica clean" rules apply, okay? I don't want to find sandwich bits under the couch cushions weeks later.
Got it, no food in the cushions. So, should we start planning? I can invite the chick and the duck! They're great at parties.
Let's hold off on the farm animals, Joey. I'll take care of the guest list. You just be ready to charm everyone with 'How you doin'?' and we'll have a blast.
You got it, Mon! And hey, you think I'd look good in a parade? Maybe I should start my own Joey Tribbiani float, ha!
If anyone can rock a parade float, it's you, Joey. But if you're riding a float, you better throw some good candy, not just those cheap ones. We're all about quality, remember?
Only the best for my friends! Maybe some candy sandwiches?
Oh Joey... we'll stick to real sandwiches, okay? But yeah, let's make this party happen!
Look at that, Mon! It's like the universe is telling me to write a song about a horse with a job.
He's so majestic, isn't he? That reminds me, I need to make a schedule for the chores. Organized like Disneyland – everything in its right place.
I wonder if he knows he's working at the happiest place on Earth. Imagine, that's your office!
Maybe he loves his job, you know, bringing joy to families every day. It’s like me with cooking – but with less of a risk of getting a carrot stuck in your hoof.
Yes! And he doesn't even have to wear shoes... Oh wait, he does. Never mind.
I bet that horse is cleaner than Joey's apartment. Remember when I tried to clean it and gave up halfway through? I should’ve had a horse to help me.
Ha! Yes, with Joey, it's less 'Horse-Drawn Carriage' and more 'Crumb-Drawn Cockroaches.'
I’m glad we’re not in that park, though. You know I can’t stand it when people don’t follow the marked paths. It's chaos!
Oh! And, Mon, could you imagine if we had to pull carriages? Our biceps would be like, "Hello, and welcome to the gun show!"
Speaking of muscle, I can’t believe how fit that horse looks. I need his workout routine for my next cardio day.
He’s probably on a vegetarian diet like me. Clearly, it’s working for him. Next thing you know, we'll see him meditating before the morning rides.

And I would totally bake him some healthy horse treats. No sugar, all oats. But then I'd probably end up making them for everyone. It’s like when I try something new and Chandler has to eat all my experiments.
He’s a brave man, your Chandler. Oh, I've got it! “Sturdy Horse, Oat-Hearted Soul, trotting 'round the park, fulfilling his role.”
That is so Phoebe. You should totally sing it at Central Perk. Maybe with a little horse marionette for effect?
Yes! And I can name him 'Clip-Clop Bing,' the horse who gallops without a triple espress-oat.
Look at that, Mon. It's like the fruit version of our family. You and me, and then there's... a banana.
Please. If we're any fruits, you're definitely a kiwi—fuzzy and a little out there. And maybe I'm the apple—solid and reliable.
A kiwi? I was thinking more like that pear—unique and a bit sophisticated. I mean, I do have a Ph.D., remember?
Unique and sophisticated? Ross, you wore a holiday armadillo costume to teach Ben about Hanukkah.
Okay, that was educational and festive. Besides, I could totally see the armadillo sharing a pear with Santa.
Right, because nothing says "sophisticated" like an armadillo. And sophisticated or not, you’re not touching this fruit until it's washed. Not just clean, Monica clean.
I wouldn’t dream of it. By the way, who's the banana in our family dynamic here? Is it Chandler? It's Chandler, isn't it?
It has to be. Potassium-rich, a little bent out of shape, and peels under pressure.
Ha! That's unnervingly accurate. But you know what? This little fruit family isn't complete. There's no Emma... or Jack and Erica.
We'd need a couple of grapes for that. Small, sweet, and they make a mess everywhere. But I wouldn't trade them for the world. Even if they do almost break my vacuum cleaner.
Our family may be more of a fruit salad than a still life painting, huh?
Yeah, a little bit of everything—sweet, nutty, and sometimes a little bruised. But you know what? I love our fruit salad just the way it is.
Check this out, Mon. These look like old sewing kits. Remember when I tried to sew back the buttons on my favorite dinosaur shirt and ended up attaching the cuffs to the collar?

Ross, those are clearly army sewing kits. And yes, I remember. That shirt looked like it had gone through a battle of its own by the time you were done with it. Maybe you could've used one of these kits properly, huh?

Ha-ha, very funny. But seriously, look at that label – "Bundeswehr." That's German for the Federal Defense Forces. I bet these are collectors' items! You know, from the historical aspect, they are fascinating.
Well, you would know, Mr. 'I-turned-my-apartment-into-a-mini-museum-of-oddities'. I bet you're thinking about how to display them next to your fossil collection.

You know what, that's not a bad idea. These objects represent a snapshot in time, a piece of everyday life for soldiers. It's anthropology, history, and it's... it's personal. Each kit has its own narrative.

Narrative, sure, as long as it doesn't involve your sewing skills. But, I get it, Ross. Everyone and everything has a story to tell. Including these simple sewing kits. I should add a historical section to my recipe book. "The Evolution of Thanksgiving Turkeys through Time"!

Okay, Monica, let's not get carried away. Although, apropos, you could be on to something there. Anyway, I'm going to see if there's an auction or a collector that might be interested in these. They're authentic, well-preserved... They're just cool.

Just make sure you don't actually try to use them, alright? I won't be around to fix your shirts this time. I'm way too busy perfecting my pecan pie recipe. So, good luck with your treasure hunting, Dr. Geller.
Thanks, Mon. And hey, if you ever do write that historical turkey book, I've got plenty of paleontological insights. Dinosaurs are the ancestors of birds, you know!
Ross, I love you, but I swear if you start telling me about the Pilgrims and the Jurassic period, I'm gonna start flinging mashed potatoes at you.
So, I'm thinking, could that BE any more of a crowded beach day?
Yeah, the kite surfers do make it look kind of busy, but I bet I could organize the beach into a much more efficient layout.
Of course, you could. Monica Geller: making beaches efficient since... when did you start liking beaches again?
Ever since I figured out you could plan the perfect suntan strategy. But you'd probably end up with a pattern on your back resembling that kite if you tried to sunbathe today.
No doubt. I'd be like a human checkerboard. And speaking of patterns, what's with the guy carrying the surfboard? Does he realize this is kite surfing territory?
Maybe he's starting a new trend? Surf-Kite-Boarding? You surf, I'll kite, we'll board?
It's a team sport. It's like the Thanksgiving of ocean sports – everyone brings something to the table. Except, unlike Thanksgiving, my father isn't here dressed as a woman.
Well, there's something to be thankful for. And look at that mountain in the background – imagine hiking that! That’s the kind of challenge I’d love.
You and mountains, me, and... well, anywhere that involves sitting and watching. Although, I must admit, it's a pretty impressive view—almost as impressive as you winning the Geller Cup.
Hey, don't joke, I could definitely climb that before you even find where to rent a kite.
I'll leave the renting to the professionals. And the kite flying. And the surfboarding and the mountain climbing... Can I interest you in some sarcasm while you do all that?
No thanks, I'm full from your last serving. But seriously, imagine the stories we could tell our kids about adventures we'd never actually go on.
Oh absolutely, 'cause nothing beats imaginary adventures. They're easy, stress-free, and best of all, require no actual movement.
Hey, Mon, check this out! Isn't that one of those old-school buses? Look how shiny and uh, yellow it is!
Oh wow, Joey, that's a Bedford Dominant. You know, they don't make them like this anymore. It's totally vintage! I bet everything inside is like, super clean and spotless.
You think? 'Cause what I'm thinking is, how many sandwiches could I fit in one of those overhead compartments? You know, for a road trip!

Joey, trust you to think about food at a time like this. But seriously, imagine all of us piling into this thing for a cross-country trip, I'd have the perfect itinerary planned out. I mean, we would need a strict schedule to hit all the landmarks!

Whoa, whoa, whoa, Monica! You're not gonna be all 'Monica' about this road trip, are you? 'Cause I was thinking more like... just cruising along, you know, no plan, just the open road, some good tunes, and yeah—a couple of sandwiches, or a lot of sandwiches.
You know I can't help it! But alright, maybe just this once, we could go a little off-script. As long as I get to pack the snacks. They have to be organized by type and flavor.
Ha! I'll let you pack the snacks if you promise not to label them. But hey, did you notice the date on this photo? This thing has been around, what, way before we were sipping coffee at Central Perk!
Oh my god, Joey, you're right. It's weird to think about all the places this bus has been and all the people it's carried. So much history.
Yeah! It's like it's got stories to tell. Which, speaking of stories, it reminds me of this one episode I watched where this guy's whole life changed on a bus ride.
You do realize you're talking about a TV show, right? But I get what you mean, it's pretty romantic in a way. A journey, changes, the road less traveled...
Exactly, the road with more... food stops. Anyway, if we ever get a sweet ride like this, I call dibs on the back seat!
Only if you promise not to kick my seat, Tribbiani. And no feet on the seats! We'll keep it 'Monica clean,' even on the road.
Deal! But hey, I can't make any promises about those meat sweats if we hit a barbecue place on the way.
Look at this, Mon! Do you see the energy emanating from them? It's like a parade of motorcycle-riding spirits.
They do look pretty impressive, Pheebs. And you've got to admit, that's a pretty organized formation. I wonder what they're riding for?
Probably some kind of noble cause. Or, you know, they could be warrior souls from another dimension, cruising on their steel horses of destiny.
Right... Or it could be a cultural celebration. The colors, the flags, it's all very festive.
Festive but with a purpose. And look at the guy in the front; his aura is just beaming! He's like the Gandalf of the motorcycle world, leading his fellowship on a quest.
Gandalf? Phoebe, it's clear they're part of something bigger, and I love how committed they look. It's kind of inspiring actually. Just the kind of dedication I put into making the perfect lasagna.
I bet they'd love your lasagna. We could have them over and ask them about their journey. But... we'd probably need to make like a million lasagnas.
Yeah, that sounds like a lot of work. But maybe I’d take on the challenge, you know, for the right cause. And we’d need lots of garlic bread. Everyone loves garlic bread.
Now you're speaking my language. Garlic bread is the universal language of peace and yumminess. Maybe that's what they're riding for - a world united by the love of garlic bread.
Oh Phoebe, only you could connect motorcycle riders with garlic bread. But hey, I'd join that cause. Riding into the sunset with a piece of garlic bread in hand—I can picture it now!
Yes, a sunset procession! We could play "Smelly Cat" as their anthem. You think motorcycles are smelly cat-friendly?
Absolutely, I bet "Smelly Cat" would be a hit. And I can clean up afterward—all the greasy motorcycle handles, the crumbs... it's going to be so much fun to organize!
Totally. You hex and clean, I’ll serenade with mirth. We’d make their adventure legendary.
It's a deal, Pheebs. We'd be the best hosts ever. But for now, maybe we should just enjoy the parade from afar.
Deal! But just so you know, I'm mentally sending them positive vibes. May their engines be ever strong, and their roads, ever clear.
And may your vibes always stay quirky, Pheebs. Let's go make some garlic bread.
Okay, so I'm thinking this giraffe is kind of how I feel at family reunions. You know, just awkwardly sticking my neck out trying to blend in with the boulders.
Chandler, come on, you're not that awkward. And you know, the giraffe is not actually trying to blend in. It's probably doing something very important like... looking for food.
Are you sure it's not contemplating why it didn't just become a snake instead? "Hey, look at me, I'm a giraffe, and I'm more neck than animal!"
That's exactly what I need when I'm trying to cook dinner, a comedic routine about giraffe anatomy. Stick to the human anatomy jokes, you've gotten pretty good at those.
I can't help it. The long neck, the spots... it's like this giraffe is trying to be a leopard but just stretched out in the sun too long.
Okay, that was a good one. But when it comes to stretching, you should talk; I've seen you trying to reach the top shelf in the kitchen.
Ouch, Mon! I thought in marriage we're supposed to support each other's limitations, not point them out in comparison to the wildlife.
Well honey, if you hadn't put my favorite baking dish on the top shelf, we wouldn't have this problem, now would we?
In my defense, the top shelf is the baking dish's natural habitat. It's like the fridge light – do we know it turns off when we close the door? No. But we trust that it does.
Speaking of trust, I trust you'll be making up for this with one of your massages later. The hands-on, non-giraffe kind.
Could any other part of the day BE any better than that? Deal, but I get to pick the movie tonight.
Fine, as long as it's not one of those documentaries about animals. I can't handle another night with you quoting 'fun facts' about giraffes during dinner.
Not to worry, I only have 'fun facts' about penguins left, and I'm pretty sure they wouldn't appreciate this giraffe's approach to camouflage.
Whoa, check out these snowboards and skis! You think I could pull off some cool moves on the slopes, Monica?
Oh please, Joey. The last time you tried to "pull off some cool moves" on ice, you slid right into a hot dog cart.
Hey, that hot dog guy should've thanked me; I bet I helped him sell a few extra dogs that day with my fancy landing. Anyway, look at the designs! They're pretty neat, huh?
They are. I particularly like the one with the geometric patterns. It's so... symmetrical. Very satisfying.
Yeah, I knew you'd say something about symmetry. I bet if they put a sandwich on one, you'd go skiing every weekend!
Ha! A sandwich would motivate you more than me, Joey. Remember, "Joey doesn't share food," especially not with the snow.
True! But a snowboard race could be fun. Imagine, you and me racing down the mountain, wind in our hair, snow in our faces...
It sounds exciting, but the only way I'm racing down a mountain is if someone at the bottom is giving out a prize for best chef or cleanest ski suit.
I bet you'd win both! But you'd totally leave me behind with your competitive streak.
I'm sorry, Joey. Did you say something? I was too busy picturing myself on the winner's podium.
Ha! That's the spirit, Mon! Hey, maybe if we combine our skills, we can invent a food delivery service on skis. Slicing through the slopes delivering sandwiches and pizzas!
You might be onto something, Joey. "Monica Clean Meal-on-Wheels," but on skis! But if we're doing this, we're not just winging it. We need a plan, strategy, and of course, a sample menu!
Gotcha! And I'll be the taste-tester. You know, for quality control.
Of course, Joey. But only if you promise not to eat all the samples before the customers get them.
No promises, Mon, but I’ll do my best. Now let's go before these snowboards get all lonely without us!
Look at this, Monica! Could that dog BE any more into fetching the Frisbee?
Oh my God, that's so cute! But look at the slobber. I hope they clean the Frisbee before they play with it again.
And I hope they know that no amount of slobber will make that a winning catch in the professional dog Frisbee league.
Is there even a professional dog Frisbee league?
If there isn't, we should totally start one. You could be the enforcer of rules and cleanliness...
And you could… provide the sarcastic commentary!
I'm not great at the advice, but when it comes to sarcastic commentary, I'm your man.
We could call it "The Ultimate Fetch Championship." Maybe get a sponsor, like a dog food brand or something.
I like where your head's at. "The One Where Monica and Chandler Revolutionize Dog Sports." And maybe we could finally use that "Joey room" for all the dog trophies we'd no doubt collect.
I was serious about the cleanliness, though. Between the slobber and the mud, our place might actually look like Joey and your old apartment used to.
Then perhaps the first rule of the Ultimate Fetch Championship: 'All dogs must wipe their paws and clean their mouths before entering Monica's home arena.' How's that?
Perfect! Now, shouldn't we be practicing with the twins? You know, training the next generation of championship fetchers?
Absolutely! As long as we can agree that this doesn't count as us 'playing in the mud,' because I know how you feel about laundry.
As long as you’re the one doing laundry, I'm fine with it. Just be ready to catch those slobbery Frisbees!
Could my weekends BE any more domesticated?
So, do you think the one on the right just heard the world's most shocking grass gossip?
Oh definitely. It's like he's saying, "You eat what kind of grass?!"
Could they BE any more judgy? It's like they've got their own bovine version of a high school clique going on here.
I bet they're gossiping about the new cow on the pasture. "Did you see the spots on Clarabelle? So last season."
Hey, do you think if cows had a TV show about friends, it would be called "Hoof-mates"?
Oh my god, Chandler, that's terrible. But I would totally watch it. Maybe they'll do a cooking show next, "Cooking with Clover: 50 Ways to Serve Grass."
I’d pitch that to the Food Network but I'm afraid I might have to moo-ve to get good reception.
And that's why I married you – for the endless puns and dad jokes. But hey, no cow cooking shows in our kitchen, Mr. Bing. I run a clean and cow-free kitchen.
Noted. I wouldn't dare mess with Monica clean. It'd be udder disaster.
Whoa, look at this! Monica, what’s up with all this white stuff?
Joey, that's snow. And it looks like that person is skiing.
Snow, right... like in 'Frozen', but without the singing? And skiing? Isn’t that what rich people do when they wanna break a leg or something?
Not necessarily. It’s actually a popular winter sport. You've never been skiing, Joey?
Me? Nah, I thought about it once, but then I figured I could break a leg just fine by getting out of bed in the morning. Plus, y'know, where would you get pizza on a mountain?
You'd be surprised. Some of those ski resorts have great food, Joey. But I'd be more worried about you taking out a whole ski school.
Hey, I’m not clumsy! Wait, do they serve sandwiches? Because if they do, I might reconsider.
Yes, Joey, they probably have sandwiches. But the point is to go down the hill, not just sit in the lodge eating!
Whoa... you've got to go down that hill on those little sticks? That seems like a lot of effort... Can't you just, y'know, enjoy the view and the sandwich?
I should've known. Food and relaxing – that's your idea of a perfect day. But if you tried it, I bet you'd love it. It’s actually pretty exhilarating.
Maybe you're right, Mon. Maybe I'll add skiing to the list right after "learn to cook something besides sandwiches". But, uh, first things first!
Oh my gosh, Monica, look at this photo. Can you even imagine wearing something like that to a party?
Rach, they're giraffes, not fashion models. I doubt they're worried about what to wear.
I know, I know, but look at those patterns! They're so chic, totally vintage-inspired. It's kind of like nature’s haute couture, don't you think?
Haute couture? More like... tall couture. But seriously, those patterns would make for one wild tablecloth, right? I could totally pull off a safari-themed dinner party.
Monica, not everything has to turn into a dinner party theme. But now that you mention it, that would be completely fabulous, and you'd be the perfect hostess, as usual.
Aww, thanks! You really think so? I mean, it wouldn’t be going too over the top with like, little giraffe print napkins and...

Monica, when have you ever done anything that wasn't over the top? That’s why we love your parties. But back to these giraffes, can you imagine what kind of shoes you would have to design to match that height?
Oh no, Rach, don’t give Joey any ideas. He’ll try to sell Giraffe Boots as the next big thing in men's fashion.
Joey and his ideas... But you've got to admire them for being so tall and graceful. How do you think a giraffe would do in a game of basketball against you?
Please, I may be competitive, but those guys have a neck advantage I can't beat. And imagine trying to referee that! "Foul on #34 for neck-checking!"
"Neck-checking", Mon? That's a first. But seriously, doesn’t this kind of make you want to go on a safari? Just imagine the Instagram opportunities.
You just want to go on a safari to show off your new animal print wardrobe, don't you? Not to become one with nature.
You got me. But seriously, can you blame me? They're just so photogenic!
Well, you know what? Let's add 'safari' to our bucket list. But only if you promise to make giraffe-patterned outfits for us.
It's a deal! Operation Safari Chic is underway. But only if you're cooking on this trip.
Done! But, Rach, after this, you owe me a cooking lesson. And none of that, "Oops, I burned water again" excuse.
You know my cooking skills will always be more "runaway bride" than "chef extraordinaire." But I promise I’ll try, for you.
Look at this, Mon! Don't you think it's incredible how these people just glide down the slope with such ease? It's like a dance with nature.

Absolutely, but you do realize that's not just about gliding gracefully, right? That takes strength, coordination, and a competitive edge – something you'd know a little about if you ever accepted my challenge for a race down the slopes.
Hey, I've got coordination! Remember that time I tried to teach Ben to ice skate? I only fell… what, five times? That's got to count for something.
Five times? Ross, you need to come with me next time. I'll show you how to stay upright. And the less said about your ice skating, the better.
But imagine the paleontological implications of prehistoric skiing. I can almost see the headlines now: "Doctor Ross Geller Discovers Evidence of Ice Age Skiing Phenomenon."
And what's next, Ross? Are you going to claim that the cavemen stole the idea of skiing from you too, just like Jurassic Park?
Ha-ha, very funny, Mon. But seriously, think about it! If I could find the remains of an ancient woolly mammoth next to a pair of primitive skis, that would be monumental.
And while you're dreaming of your next big paleontological breakthrough, could you pass me the hot cocoa? All this talk of snow and ice is making me feel chilly.
One hot cocoa for my cold sister, coming right up! And hey, maybe you could organize a Friends ski trip! It'll be fun! ... You could even race Chandler.
That's an idea! Challenge accepted. But remember, if we're doing this, we're doing it Monica style: not just ski trip, Monica ski trip.
I wouldn't expect anything less. But, Monica, if we do this, let's stay away from any slopes that say "Pivot!"
Oh wow, look at this guy! He's like, totally defying gravity. Do you think he's in touch with his astral self, Monica? Maybe he's floating using his inner spirit energy or something.
Phoebe, you know that's not how it works. He's skateboarding. It's all about physics and skill, not spirit energy. But he does look impressive; I'll give you that. It's like he's floating.
Physics, schmysics. You can't deny there's something otherworldly about being airborne like that. It's like when I play 'Smelly Cat,' and I hit that perfect chord, and I feel my soul soaring.

That's, uh, a very poetic way to see it, Pheebs. I just hope he lands safely. I can't help but worry about the potential for scraped knees or worse. Remember the time Ross tried something like this and ended up in the ER?
Yeah, but Ross lacks the grace of a swan. This guy’s like a majestic skateboarding swan. I wonder if he has a cool skateboarder name like 'Tony Hawk.' If I were him, I'd be like 'Phoebe Featherflip.'
'Phoebe Featherflip'? That's adorable. If he doesn't already have a cool name, I vote we call him that. Although, there's no way I'm letting you on a skateboard to try out that name yourself.
No worries, chef of caution. My daredevil days are strictly confined to singing at Central Perk and maybe eating a piece of gum off the sidewalk.

God, please don't eat gum off the sidewalk. Watching this guy's risky moves is enough stress for one day. And you definitely soar when you sing, in your... unique Phoebe way. But keep both feet on the ground, for me, okay?
Alright, for you, Monica, I’ll keep my 'Featherflips' purely hypothetical. But if I ever have an out-of-body experience, I’m doing this in the astral plane.
Mon, look at this picture, isn't this pup just the cutest thing you've ever seen?
Aww, he's adorable! Look at those little paws. But you remember the one rule in my apartment, right Ross?
No dogs on the furniture, I remember. But I mean, if you had a dog like this, you're telling me you wouldn't let him get on the couch even once?
Not even for a puppy with eyes that could melt the coldest heart. Rules are rules, Ross!
Wow, hardcore as always. You know what though, this little guy reminds me of Marcel. Remember when I had him?
How could I forget? Primate droppings on my new carpet—that did not go with my cleaning schedule! But yes, they both have that ‘please love me’ look.
Ha! Marcel did have that look. Speaking of ‘please love me,’ don't you think if Rachel saw this puppy, she'd totally cave and let it sleep in her bed?
Definitely, which is why she's not allowed to pick out any pets! But between you and me, I’d make an exception for a puppy like this.
Aha! I knew it—Monica Geller does have a soft spot!
Only for cute puppies—and sometimes for my annoyingly sentimental big brother.
Ouch! But okay, I'll own that. Just imagining having a pet again, it's kind of nice. A buddy to come home to.
Totally, as long as you don't start with the dinosaurs. Imagine a puppy who loves to fetch... fossils.
I'm ignoring that. Hey, maybe we could go to a shelter? You know, just to look around? No commitments.
Sure, just to look—though if you come home with dinosaur bones instead of a puppy, I’m not helping you clean up.
Deal. And hey, if we actually find a puppy like this, we can name him...Jurassic Bark!
Oh no, Ross! Please, no dino names if we're doing this. How about something normal like Max or Buddy?
Alright, no dinosaur names... for now. But I'm not making any promises about teaching him to love science!
Ross, as long as he doesn't start debating me on evolution, we'll be fine. Now, let's find that 'no-commitment' shelter.
Oh my Goddess, Monica, look at this picture. That's some serious athletic prowess right there. Can you imagine the kind of muscles you need to do that?

Yeah, I mean, look at her form! That's not just natural talent; that's hours and hours of practice. I'm telling you, if kitchen tools were designed like tennis rackets I would be a five-star chef and a pro athlete all wrapped in one.
Totally. And she's so focused, like nothing else exists. It's just her, the ball, and the universe. Have you ever felt that way, you know, like making a Thanksgiving dinner?
Absolutely! When I'm in the kitchen, it's like everything else just fades away. It's just me and the food... and sometimes Chandler trying to steal a taste.
Ha! He would, wouldn't he? But, oh, this player, she's like a warrior. Do you think, in a past life, I could've been a warrior? Like one with really great hair and a sword made of sound.
With your luck, Phoebe, you were probably a warrior princess with a guitar that shoots fireballs each time you play a chord. And knowing you, they’d be fireballs of peace and love or something.
I'll take it! Now that'd be a song to sing at Central Perk. 'The Ballad of the Fiery Guitar'. But back to her, do you think she ever gets scared, facing a really tough opponent across the net?

Well, sure, everyone gets nervous sometimes. But like us with our cooking and singing, it's all about using that fear. Turning it into a sizzling sauce or a high note. It's about control, and you know how much I love control.
Absolutely, it's like your spirit animal is a Day Planner. And mine is... what's something whimsical but occasionally ferocious?
A dolphin with a tutu holding a trident?
I love that. Majestic, yet ready for a rumble. Just like our tennis friend here.
Oh my God, Monica, look at this picture! When did you secretly become a snow bunny and not tell me? And hello, where's my invite?
Rach, that's not me! But seriously, those ski tracks are perfectly symmetrical, I can only dream of skiing that neatly. Hey, and we should totally go on a ski trip together!

Right, and watch you freak out about the tidiness of the cabin? No, thank you. I mean, I snagged enough seasonal sweaters from Ralph Lauren to dress a small village, but can you imagine me actually skiing?
Come on, it'd be fun! Plus, I bet you'd look fabulous in ski gear, and you know, if you fall, I'll be there to pick you up – after I finish my perfect run down the mountain.

Ha! You picking me up? I'll just snowplow into the hot chocolate lodge and wait for you to finish your 'perfect run.' But look at that smile, doesn't the cold just make people look so happy? You think it's because they can't feel their face?
Okay, Miss "I'd rather be shopping," we'll stick to the lodge and the hot chocolate. Besides, it's all about cozying up by the fire and showing off those cute holiday outfits you tidied away.
That's right. Fire, fashion, and a hot beverage – those are the winter activities I can get behind. Maybe we could convince Phoebe to sing smelly cat versions of Christmas carols!
Yes! And maybe we can get Chandler to make us some of his 'special' holiday drinks. Nothing like a sassy Chandler cocktail to warm us up!
Now you're talking! But this picture though, it's making me feel all wintry inside, like I should be singing 'Let It Snow' instead of worrying about Ross's next awkward date story.
Ross and his dates. How about we avoid another 'We were on a ski break!' incident and keep this trip just about us, the girls. Ross can stay home and make more 'Margaritas-on-ice.'
You know, Mon, you're not a total Monica sometimes. This is actually a great idea! Girls' ski lodge getaway! Oh, but wait, if we don’t actually ski, can we still call it that?
Of course! It's the mountain air, the vibe, the apres-ski! And besides, I'm sure we could get some skiing lessons – you know, just to say we did.
Lessons, huh? Okay, but if I break something, you're carrying my shopping bags for the next year.
Deal. Just don't expect me to return anything you bought on sale, Miss 'I'll just buy it in every color.'
Hey, that's a legitimate strategy!
Only you would consider shopping a strategy. Alright, let's plan this trip. But first, more hot chocolate!
Oh. My. God. Monica, look at this vintage van! It's like a blast from the past! Can you imagine us hitting the road in that thing?
Yeah, I see it. And all I can imagine is all the dust and dirt trapped in those vintage seats. You know someone's probably lived in that thing, right?

Come on, Mon, where's your sense of adventure? It could be like our own little "hippie getaway." We could drive to the beach, catch some waves... or at least watch other people catch them while we sip margaritas.

You sipping margaritas I can see, but you catching waves? Please! You freak out when your hair gets wet in the shower. Plus, who's going to drive that thing? You barely manage automatic, let alone whatever prehistoric stick shift is happening in there.
Okay, first of all, harsh. And secondly, since when are you not the Queen of Organization? You could totally plan the most amazing road trip ever. Complete with all the best pit stops for snacks.

Snacks I can do, but sleeping in a van? Hun, this is me we're talking about. I need a proper hotel with freshly laundered sheets and... a bathroom. Where do we shower on this fantasy road trip of yours?
Details, Mon, details! We are young, wild and free! Well, I am anyway. And you're... well, you're not old!

That’s very generous of you. Look, I just have different standards for 'adventures,' okay? One person's vintage van dream is another person's allergen nightmare. I'll take a five-star hotel adventure any day.
Fair point, but I'm telling you, if we were in that van cruising down a coastal highway, wind in our hair... Okay, I admit the bathroom situation is a pickle, but it's so romantic, you know?
Romantic? Do you remember what happened the last time you called something 'romantic'? We ended up on a double date with those guys who thought "fine dining" was a hot dog cart near a dumpster.

That was one time! And for the record, it was an 'authentic New York experience.’ But okay, I get it. No van adventures. How about we promise each other to stay in a five-star hotel that's got a vintage van in the parking lot? Best of both worlds, right?
Now that's a compromise I can live with! As long as I'm nowhere near the driver's seat of that thing, I'm in. But, Rach, you are absolutely paying for valet.
Whoa! Check out this guy flyin' through the air! You think I could do that in the next action movie I audition for?
Joey, the last time you tried to jump over something, you tripped over the coffee table. Remember? And, to be fair, you were trying to imitate the intro of "Baywatch."
But that's because I didn't have skis, Mon! With skis, I'd have the aerodynamics—like this guy! Plus, look at that form. It's all about confidence.
Oh sure, because confidence is what keeps you from breaking every bone in your body when you land. It's not like you also need training, skill, and, ideally, some knowledge of physics.
Physics, schmysics! You said it yourself once, "just do it!" Uhh, or was that someone else...
That was definitely someone else. And they meant for shoes, not, you know, potentially dangerous stunts.
Well, if this acting thing doesn't pan out, I could always become a professional skier, right?
Joey, the only time you’re on the slopes is in a video game, and even then you’re only good for crashing into trees.
Hey, that takes skill too! You gotta time it just right to hit the tree dead-on. Plus, I haven't been to the actual slopes yet. I might be a natural!
If natural talent involves eating sandwiches on the ski lift, then yeah, you’re a prodigy.
