Ooh, skis and sandwiches... Could I combine the two? Like a sandwich delivery ski service!
And what, pray tell, would you call this new venture of yours?
"Sub-zero Subs"! Huh? "Get your footlongs at the speed of... downhill!" I'm onto something here, Mon!
Well, I’ll give you credit for creativity, Joey. But how about we stick to watching winter sports and leave the high-flying to the professionals?
Alright, alright, I'll leave it to the pros. But if they ever want a stuntman who can cry on command, they know who to call! "How you doin'?"
Please, Joey, don't start flirting with the skiers!
You see that stone fireplace in the back, Mon? Kind of reminds me of the one at Aunt Sylvia's place, doesn't it?
Absolutely! Those stones look...wait, is that moss growing between the rocks, Ross? Because if it is, it's not Monica clean!

Haha, yeah, I guess Aunt Sylvia wasn't quite as meticulous as someone I know. But I was thinking, geologically speaking, the stone selection is quite fascinating. I wonder about the sedimentary layers...

Ross, only you would think about rock layers when looking at a fireplace. I'm more interested in that kitchen setup. Double ovens? That's a cooking dream! Were you thinking of upgrading yours to something like that for all the...dinosaurs you roast?
Ha-ha, very funny, Mon. Seriously though, a setup like that could be amazing for Thanksgiving. You could cook, like, seven turkeys at once.
Don't tempt me. Although, I'm not so sure about the wood cabinets. I'd probably go with something more modern. And, Ross, we're on a break from turkey, remember? No more turkey talk until November!
Of course, how could I forget? "We were on a break." But hey, is that a chandelier I see in the dining area? Kinda classy.
Yeah, it's nice. Simple, not too over the top. Could use a good dusting, though. And look at those flowers; they really brighten up the room. I'd probably add some more color to this place, though.
Well, it's a good thing you’re not a shoe then because as a purse or a hat, your decorative flair would really stand out in a place like this.
I know! But back to what's important. Imagine the dinner parties I could throw here! And if there's enough counter space, I could even set up a little cooking class.
I can see it now. "Monica's Marvelous Morsels." You would be such a hit. Hey, that's a catchy name, you could trademark it!
Hmm, not bad, Ross. But for now, maybe just pass the ideas and not the judgement on the stone moss, okay?
Oh. My. God. Monica, come look at this! Is that a zebra? Wait, it has a mane like a horse. I'm so confused.
Let me see. Oh, that's not just any zebra, that my friend, is a zonkey! It's like a cross between a donkey and a zebra. Isn't Mother Nature amazing?
A zonkey? That's like something out of Phoebe's songbook! Are you sure it's not wearing pajamas or something?
I'm positive. It's all real. You know, this kind of thing happens in the wild sometimes, and the result is this incredibly rare and beautiful creature.

Wow, it's like when you mix a margarita with a piña colada and get the best of both worlds. You should see if you can cook up some kind of zonkey dish at the restaurant. I mean, not a real zonkey, but something that combines two amazing things.

Rachel! You do not cook zonkeys. And that, by the way, would be called fusion cuisine, but definitely no zonkeys in it. Maybe I can create a dessert inspired by the zonkey's stripes – something with chocolate and vanilla.
That's much better. So sophisticated! Just like you, Mon. I bet it'll be perfection, as always.
Of course, it has to be! I can't have people eating mediocre dessert. So, speaking of unique combinations, how's your latest fashion line coming along?
Well, let's just say I'm trying to mix things up a bit, get away from the usual 'shoe' designs. Who knows, maybe I should find inspiration in zonkeys! They're quite the trendsetters, don't you think?
Absolutely! If anyone can make zonkey-chic happen, it's you, Rachel Green, fashion goddess and animal print innovator.
So, I'm looking at this pitcher, and you know what comes to mind?
Hmm, let me guess, an inappropriate joke about baseballs?
Oh no, you've had enough of those. I was actually thinking that this guy could teach me a thing or two about throwing—maybe then I wouldn't have tossed my wedding vows into the pond.
Chandler, they flew out of your hand because of the wind. Plus, you remembered every word, which, by the way, was very impressive.
That's true, I did memorize them like they were the cheat codes to my favorite video game.

I just can't with you sometimes. But look at his form! It's perfect. Honestly, if I could get my Thanksgiving turkey to fly into the oven with that kind of precision, we'd never have another holiday meal disaster.
Could that BE any more Monica? Speaking of which, no Thanksgiving flashbacks? I'm proud of you!
Please. I’ve moved past that. These days, I'm all about those perfect holiday spreads. Gives me a rush just thinking about it.
Well, just promise me you'll never apply those intense culinary techniques to my massages, okay?
No promises, Bing. You know you love my 'turbo-mode' shoulder knead.
Yes, nothing says 'I love you' quite like turning my muscles into Thanksgiving mash.
Now, that's the spirit! Speaking of which, I'm thinking roast chicken tonight. Ready to be my sous-chef?
As long as I get to swing the kitchen utensils like that guy with his baseball mitt, I'm in!
Deal. But if you accidentally throw a kitchen knife, I'm getting a new husband on the waivers.
Noted. Keep sharp objects away from the Chandler.
Look at those tulips trying to escape from Alcatraz!
Phoebe, they're not trying to escape, they're arranged in a vase. And Alcatraz?
Yeah, don't you see it? The vase is like a tiny, clear fortress and the tulips are the inmates. It's like nature's prison break.
Only you would think of flowers as prisoners. They're just...well, neatly organized!
Neatly organized by man, sure, but aren't you curious why one of the flowers is facing the other way? It's the mastermind, the one who's plotting the whole thing.
Or maybe the florist just put it in facing the wrong way.
That's exactly what they want you to think. This is a deliberate act of floral rebellion.
Okay. Assuming it is a floral rebellion, what do you think they're rebelling against? The water?
No, Monica, not the water. It's the constraints of society! They want to be wild, blowing in the wind, free to live their tuli-life.
Tuli-life? Oh, Phoebe, you're...
What? I'm just saying, if I were a flower, I wouldn't want to be stuck behind plexiglass either.
Alright, if those flowers could move, where do you think they would go?

To the park! To be with the pigeons and the street performers and that guy who thinks he's a statue. They'd write songs about their journey, blossoming into who they're really meant to be. Maybe even a "Smelly Cat" sort of anthem.
I would love to hear the flower version of "Smelly Cat." Maybe you could write it for Central Perk’s next open mic?
That’s not a bad idea. Imagine me, singing with a bouquet of runaway tulips. It'd be a performance no one would forget!
No one ever does forget your performances, Pheebs. The question is, would the tulips be your backup singers, or would they get lead vocals?
Hmm, definitely backup. I don't share the spotlight with anyone, not even tulips with attitude.
Look at that fluffy feline reigning over its electronic kingdom. Do you think it's contemplating the meaning of its nine lives?
That's a cat on a game console, Phoebe. And it's totally covering the vents! It's going to overheat!
I doubt that's a concern. Cats are mystical creatures, Monica. He’s probably channeling the energy from the device to perform some sort of... purr-fect ritual.
Well, all I can think about is all the cat hair that’s getting stuck inside. Doesn’t that bother you?
Not at all! This majestic creature is merely a live-in fur accessory to the console. Adds character, you know? Plus, it might have healing powers—we don't know.
Healing powers? It’s going to need healing powers if the console fries! I should clean that. Do you think the owner knows it could be dangerous?
Aww, you're such a worrywart. But no, please don't clean the cat. Hey, what if this is its throne and we're witnessing the coronation of Sir Paws-a-lot?
Sir Paws-a-lot would have to find another throne if that were my console. I bet it's already full of cat hair. Ugh, the thought of cleaning it out is giving me the chills!
Okay, okay, we can agree to disagree. I see a cat expanding his empire, and you see... a cleaning project.
Exactly! Anyway, how about a song for Sir Paws-a-lot? Maybe something like 'Smelly Cat', but with more... royalty?
That's a fantastic idea! Something like, "Regal Cat, Regal Cat, what are you ruling?" I'm definitely putting that in my set list.
Just make sure you keep it away from my kitchen. And my couch. And my bed...
Noted. No royal felines in the Geller-Bing kingdom. But you gotta admit, he's kind of cute, right?
Totally. I mean, if he lived in a lint roller maybe.
Oh my god! Mon, look at this image. Isn't it bizarre to see tiny paper umbrellas in science test tubes? It's like a weird combination of my two worlds: paleontology and ... bartending?

Ross, you're not a bartender. But this is like, seriously confusing. These mini umbrellas remind me of the ones you find in those fancy tropical cocktails you'd never actually order. You know, the kind with way too much fruit on top. Who puts them in test tubes?

Yeah, I know I'm not a bartender, but it's almost as if someone organized a tropical-themed party at a science lab. You've got to admit that it's creative. Plus, it might even be functional. Imagine, using each test tube to hold a different ingredient for a cocktail!

Functional or not, it bothers me. I mean, it's messy! Look at that spill on the table. Why would someone do that and not clean it up immediately? If I were there, I'd be cleaning it before mixing anything... You know, proper mise en place!
Mise en what now?
Mise en place, Ross! It's a French term used in professional kitchens to organize and arrange ingredients. Ugh, never mind. You'd just place your fossils in alphabetical order or something.
Ha, very funny. But can we circle back to how these are potentially scientific? For all we know, this could be an avant-garde way to present a new molecular gastronomy technique!
Molecular gastronomy? Spare me the food science lecture. Why not just appreciate it for what it is? It's quirky and kind of fun. It doesn't always have to make sense, you know?
Good point. Sometimes it's nice just to look at something and think—wow, that's out of the ordinary. It sparks curiosity and conversation. Just like now!
Exactly, and look at us, having a moment over spilled drinks and paper umbrellas. Who would have thought? Now I just need to make sure I never use tiny umbrellas for your birthday drink again.
Heh, agreed. Although, a paper dinosaur would be cool... You know, for old times' sake.
Please. Like you ever grow up. That would actually be perfect for you, Ross. Just don't spill your drink, or I'll be all over you with a mop.
Hey, Mon, check this picture out. Do you think those cats are conducting some sort of surveillance operation? It’s like they’re studying their human subjects.

Surveillance, Ross? No, they're cats. They're probably just waiting for someone to walk by and drop a piece of fish or something. Although, I bet if I had their focus, I would have cleaned that entire apartment by now.

You do remember that not everything requires cleaning, right Mon? But seriously, look at that intense gaze. It's almost... prehistoric. Like they're channeling their inner big cat ancestors—perhaps plotting dominion over the living room.

You and prehistoric, Ross. You can turn any conversation into a mini-lecture about evolution. But okay, I'll bite. What if they are plotting? Maybe I can recruit them to help me organize my kitchen pantry.

Ha! Can you imagine a bunch of felines organizing your spices? They'd probably just knock everything over. Although, on second thought, it would be quite the whimsical experiment to observe animal behavior in a controlled environment like your kitchen...

Controlled environment? You do realize it's my kitchen, not a lab, right? Plus, I don't need cats. I've got my own system, and it's flawless. By the way, how's your sandwich-making experiment going? Find a way to keep Joey from eating them yet?

Okay, okay, no need to get catty... and the sandwich situation remains unresolved. And, please, let's not discuss that whole fiasco with my sandwich at work. But, look at the way those two are sitting. They really do have an eerie synchronization, don't you think?
Yeah, I see your point. It's like they purposely posed for this photo. Do you think one of them is thinking 'pivot' as they’re trying to get that window open?
Pivot... Not funny, Mon! And I believe that window is plenty open for them. Although, imagining cats trying to move furniture with my "helpful" advice is kind of hilarious.
